title: Six arrested for forcing man to transfer Rs. 1 Mn after body massage
byline: Six suspects, including a couple, have been arrested for allegedly forcing an individual to transfer Rs. 1 million from his bank account after inviting him for a body massage in Bambalapitiya.

title: Sri Lankans falling prey to cyber scam centres in Myanmar on the rise, Defence Ministry warns
byline: Sri Lankans currently staying in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) are being sent to cyber scam centres in Myanmar in groups and the National Anti-Human Trafficking Task Force (NAHTTF) has received information through reliable sources that there is an increase in the number of newly recruited Sri Lankan citizens there, the Defence Ministry said.

title: Schools to be hand over to Grama Niladharis today for election preparations
byline: All schools are to be handed over to the respective Grama Niladhari officers today (12) after classes end, in preparation for the parliamentary elections scheduled for Thursday (November 14), the Education Ministry said.

title: Low-pressure area over Bay of Bengal may bring thundershowers from tomorrow
byline: The formation of a low-pressure area over the south-west Bay of Bengal today may lead to thundershowers in most parts of the island from November 13, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Sri Lanka projected to emerge as one of world’s fastest-growing travel destinations in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka is expected to rank among the world’s fastest-growing travel destinations in 2025, with tourism spending forecasted to increase by 40 percent, according to the 2024 WTM Global Travel Report, published in partnership with Tourism Economics.

title: Policy consistency crucial to boost SL’s apparel exports to US $ 8bn in 2025- JAAF
byline: Policy consistency is key to achieving US $ 8 billion in apparel exports next year, up from an estimated US $ 5 billion in 2024, according to the Joint Apparel Association Forum (JAAF).

title: Are we going to clean the dirt and create an L board Parliament? :Ranil
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who wound up the New Democratic Front (NDF) campaign for the general election said the people of Sri Lanka should decide whether they want to sweep away the dirt and end up with an L board government and a Parliament.

title: Sri Lanka will receive IMF third tranche by end of February: President
byline: Claiming that the debt restructuring process will be completed by December this year, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed confidence that Sri Lanka will receive the third tranche under the IMF Extended Fund Facility (EFF) by the end of January or early February next year.

title: CID launches probe into Channel 4 documentary on Sri Lanka’s Easter Sunday bombings
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has initiated an investigation into the documentary telecast by Britain’s Channel 4 TV on Sri Lanka’s Easter Sunday bomb attacks in 2019.

title: Hand, Foot, and Mouth disease on the rise
byline: Sri Lanka has reported a notable increase in cases of Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease (HFMD) in recent days.

title: Probe launched into controversial exam paper with political content
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Education has directed officials to conduct an immediate investigation into the second-term general knowledge exam paper given to Grade 12 students at CWW Kannangara Central College in Mathugama.

title: UN Security Council considers action on Sudan war
byline: The United Nations Security Council is discussing a British-drafted resolution that demands Sudan’s warring parties cease hostilities and calls on them to allow safe, rapid and unhindered deliveries of aid across front lines and borders.

title: Sufficient buses assigned to operate till Monday: SLTB Chairman
byline: All Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) depots have been instructed to assign their existing bus fleets for operations from today until Monday (18), SLTB Chairman Ramal Siriwardana said.

title: Fire breaks out at garment factory in Rajagiriya
byline: A fire broke out at a temporary garment factory building on Meda Welikada Road in Rajagiriya.

title: Hasaranga ruled out of ODI series against New Zealand
byline: Wanindu Hasaranga will miss the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand after sustaining a left hamstring injury while bowling in the second T20I.

title: Two Chinese women arrested in Kandy
byline: Two Chinese nationals were arrested by the Kandy Tourist Police for allegedly engaging in business activities while on tourist visas in Sri Lanka.

title: Power and Energy Ministry Secretary summoned to appear before SC
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Power and Energy was issued a notice to appear before the Supreme Court on November 19 to explain why his actions should not be considered contempt of court.
